main_definition: Semi- refers to something being halfway or partially in a particular state, condition, or category.

meanings_and_examples.example: A semi-automatic weapon is one that requires some manual operation to fire each shot.
Semi-trucks, also known as 18-wheelers, are vehicles with a trailer attached in the middle and an engine at one end of the trailer.
Semi-detached houses are two houses that share a wall but have separate entrances.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Relating to or consisting of both full and half versions
meanings_and_examples.example: A semi-final in sports competitions is the stage preceding the final match, usually involving eight teams after elimination rounds.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Involving two major groups or categories
meanings_and_examples.example: Semi-professional athletes are those who play at a high level but not at the full professional standard.
